hedline.hl1: June 28-July 4; A Hint of Leniency in Nigeria

block.p: Nigeria's new military leader took what may be the most significant step so far to reverse the abuses of his predecessor, the late Gen. Sani Abacha.
Nigeria's new military leader took what may be the most significant step so far to reverse the abuses of his predecessor, the late Gen. Sani Abacha.

The current leader, Gen. Abdulsalam Abubakar, promised the United Nations Secretary General, Kofi Annan, that all remaining political prisoners would be freed, including Moshood K. O. Abiola, who most Nigerians think won a presidential election in 1993 that General Abacha's Government aborted. The United States, one of Nigeria's sharpest critics, announced that a high-level American delegation would travel to Nigeria for talks with General Abubakar this weekend.
